revised_title: The Effects of Lightning on the Steeple and Church of Lestwithiel, Cornwall
tldr: This article describes the damage caused by lightning to the steeple and church of Lestwithiel, Cornwall. The lightning struck the top of the steeple, damaging the vane and socket, and caused significant damage to the spire, which was separated into two halves. The church's roof, ceiling, and walls were also damaged by falling stones and debris.
